member.name: T:CiteProc.v10.And
member.summary: Specifies the delimiter between the second to last and last name of the names in a name variable.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.And.Delimiter
member.summary: Selects the comma, e.g. “Doe, Johnson, Smith”.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.And.Text
member.summary: Selects the “and” term, e.g. “Doe, Johnson and Smith”.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.And.Symbol
member.summary: Selects the ampersand, e.g. “Doe, Johnson & Smith”.

member.name: T:CiteProc.v10.Collapse
member.summary: Specifies cite grouping and collapsing.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.Collapse.CitationNumber
member.summary: “citation-number” - collapses ranges of cite numbers (rendered through the “citation-number” variable) in citations for “numeric” styles (e.g. from “[1, 2, 3, 5]” to “[1–3, 5]”). Only increasing ranges collapse, e.g. “[3, 2, 1]” will not collapse.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.Collapse.Year
member.summary: “year” - collapses cite groups by suppressing the output of the cs:names element for subsequent cites in the group, e.g. “(Doe 2000, Doe 2001)” becomes “(Doe 2000, 2001)”.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.Collapse.YearSuffix
member.summary: “year-suffix” - collapses as “year”, but also suppresses repeating years within the cite group, e.g. “(Doe 2000a, b)” instead of “(Doe 2000a, 2000b)”.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.Collapse.YearSuffixRanged
member.summary: “year-suffix-ranged” - collapses as “year-suffix”, but also collapses ranges of year-suffixes, e.g. “(Doe 2000a–c,e)” instead of “(Doe 2000a, b, c, e)”.

member.name: T:CiteProc.v10.GivenNameDisambiguationRules
member.summary: Specifies a) whether the purpose of name expansion is limited to disambiguating cites, or has the additional goal of disambiguating names

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.GivenNameDisambiguationRules.AllNames
member.summary: Name expansion has the dual purpose of disambiguating cites and names. All rendered ambiguous names, in both ambiguous and umambiguous cites, are subject to disambiguation. Each name is progressively transformed until it is disambiguated. Names that can not be disambiguated remain in their original form.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.GivenNameDisambiguationRules.AllNamesWithInitials
member.summary: As “all-names”, but name expansion is limited to showing initials (see step 1(a) above). No disambiguation attempt is made when initialize-with is not set or when initialize is set to “false”.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.GivenNameDisambiguationRules.PrimaryName
member.summary: As “all-names”, but disambiguation is limited to the first name of each cite.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.GivenNameDisambiguationRules.PrimaryNameWithInitials
member.summary: As “all-names-with-initials”, but disambiguation is limited to the first name of each cite.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.GivenNameDisambiguationRules.ByCite
member.summary: Default. As “all-names”, but the goal of name expansion is limited to disambiguating cites. Only ambiguous names in ambiguous cites are affected, and disambiguation stops after the first name that eliminates cite ambiguity.

member.name: T:CiteProc.v10.ILocale
member.summary: Represents localization data which can be included either in styles or in locale files (which conveniently provide sets of default localization data), consisting of terms, date formats and grammar options. Each locale element contains localization data for a single language dialect. This locale code is set on the required xml:lang attribute on the cs:locale root element.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.ILocale.XmlLang
member.summary: The locale code of this locale.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.ILocale.StyleOptions
member.summary: Style options of the locale.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.ILocale.Dates
member.summary: Two localized date formats can be defined with cs:date elements: a “numeric” (e.g. “12-15-2005”) and a “text” format.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.ILocale.Terms
member.summary: Terms are localized strings (e.g. by using the “and” term, “Doe and Smith” automatically becomes “Doe und Smith” when the style locale is switched from English to German). Terms are either directly defined in the content of cs:term, or, in cases where singular and plural variants are needed (e.g. “page” and “pages”), in the content of the child elements cs:single and cs:multiple, respectively.

member.summary: Indicates whether the 'et-al-first' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.summary: If the number of names in a name variable is truncated, it is truncated after reaching the number of names set on et-al-use-first.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.IEtAlOptions.EtAlSubsequentMinSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'et-al-subsequent-min' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.IEtAlOptions.EtAlSubsequentUseFirst
member.summary: If the number of names in a name variable is truncated, it is truncated after reaching the number of names set on et-al-use-first.

member.summary: Indicates whether the 'et-al-subsequent-use-first' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.IEtAlOptions.EtAlUseLast
member.summary: When set to “true” (the default is “false”), name lists truncated by et-al abbreviation are followed by the name delimiter, the ellipsis character, and the last name of the original name list. This is only possible when the original name list has at least two more names than the truncated name list.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.IEtAlOptions.EtAlUseLastSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'et-al-use-last' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.INameOptions.And
member.summary: Specifies the delimiter between the second to last and last name of the names in a name variable.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.INameOptions.AndSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'and' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.INameOptions.Delimiter
member.summary: Specifies the text string used to separate names in a name variable. Default is ”, ” (e.g. “Doe, Smith”).

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.INameOptions.DelimiterPrecedesEtAl
member.summary: Determines when the name delimiter or a space is used between a truncated name list and the “et-al” (or “and others”) term in case of et-al abbreviation.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.INameOptions.DelimiterPrecedesEtAlSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'delimiter-preceded-et-al' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.INameOptions.DelimiterPrecedesLast
member.summary: Determines when the name delimiter is used to separate the second to last and the last name in name lists (if and is not set, the name delimiter is always used, regardless of the value of delimiter-precedes-last).

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.INameOptions.DelimiterPrecedesLastSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'delimiter-precedes-last' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.INameOptions.Format
member.summary: Specifies whether all the name-parts of personal names should be displayed (value “long”, the default), or only the family name and the non-dropping-particle (value “short”). A third value, “count”, returns the total number of names that would otherwise be rendered by the use of the cs:names element (taking into account the effects of et-al abbreviation and editor/translator collapsing), which allows for advanced sorting.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.INameOptions.FormatSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'form' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.INameOptions.Initialize
member.summary: When set to “false” (the default is “true”), given names are no longer initialized when “initialize-with” is set. However, the value of “initialize-with” is still added after initials present in the full name (e.g. with initialize set to “false”, and initialize-with set to ”.”, “James T Kirk” becomes “James T. Kirk”).

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.INameOptions.InitializeSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'initialize' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.INameOptions.InitializeWith
member.summary: When set, given names are converted to initials. The attribute value is added after each initial (”.” results in “J.J. Doe”).

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.INameOptions.NameAsSortOrder
member.summary: Specifies that names should be displayed with the given name following the family name (e.g. “John Doe” becomes “Doe, John”).

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.INameOptions.NameAsSortOrderSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'name-as-sort-order' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.INameOptions.SortSeparator
member.summary: Sets the delimiter for name-parts that have switched positions as a result of name-as-sort-order. The default value is ”, ” (“Doe, John”). As is the case for name-as-sort-order, this attribute only affects names written in the latin or Cyrillic alphabets.

member.summary: Specifies vertical line distance. Defaults to “1” (single-spacing), and can be set to any positive integer to specify a multiple of the standard unit of line height (e.g. “2” for double-spacing).

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.BibliographyElement.EntrySpacing
member.summary: Specifies vertical distance between bibliographic entries. By default (with a value of “1”), entries are separated by a single additional line-height (as set by the line-spacing attribute). Can be set to any non-negative integer to specify a multiple of this amount.

member.name: T:CiteProc.v10.CitationElement
member.summary: The cs:citation element describes the formatting of citations, which consist of one or more references (“cites”) to bibliographic sources. Citations appear in the form of either in-text citations (in the author (e.g. “[Doe]”), author-date (“[Doe 1999]”), label (“[doe99]”) or number (“[1]”) format) or notes.

member.summary: Compiles the Citation element.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.CitationElement.DisambiguateAddNames
member.summary: If set to “true” (“false” is the default), names that would otherwise be hidden as a result of et-al abbreviation are added one by one to all members of a set of ambiguous cites, until no more cites in the set can be disambiguated by adding names.

member.summary: Indicates whether the 'disambiguate-add-names' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.CitationElement.DisambiguateAddGivenName
member.summary: If set to “true” (“false” is the default), ambiguous names (names that are identical in their “short” or initialized “long” form, but differ when initials are added or the full given name is shown) are expanded. Name expansion can be configured with givenname-disambiguation-rule.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.CitationElement.DisambiguateAddGivenNameSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'disambiguate-add-givenname' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.CitationElement.GivenNameDisambiguationRule
member.summary: Specifies a) whether the purpose of name expansion is limited to disambiguating cites, or has the additional goal of disambiguating names (only in the latter case are ambiguous names in unambigous cites expanded, e.g. from “(Doe 1950; Doe 2000)” to “(Jane Doe 1950; John Doe 2000)”), b) whether name expansion targets all, or just the first name of each cite, and c) the method by which each name is expanded.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.CitationElement.GivenNameDisambiguationRuleSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'givenname-disambiguation-rule' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.CitationElement.DisambiguateAddYearSuffix
member.summary: If set to “true” (“false” is the default), an alphabetic year-suffix is added to ambiguous cites (e.g. “Doe 2007, Doe 2007” becomes “Doe 2007a, Doe 2007b”) and to their corresponding bibliographic entries. The assignment of the year-suffixes follows the order of the bibliographies entries, and additional letters are used once “z” is reached (“z”, “aa”, “ab”, ..., “az”, “ba”, etc.). By default the year-suffix is appended to the cite, and to the first year rendered through cs:date in the bibliographic entry, but its location can be controlled by explicitly rendering the “year-suffix” variable using cs:text. If “year-suffix” is rendered through cs:text in the scope of cs:citation, it is suppressed for cs:bibliography, unless it is also rendered through cs:text in the scope of cs:bibliography, and vice versa.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.CitationElement.DisambiguateAddYearSuffixSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'disambiguate-add-year-suffix' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.CitationElement.CiteGroupDelimiter
member.summary: Activates cite grouping and specifies the delimiter for cites within a cite group. Defaults to ”, ”. E.g. with delimiter on cs:layout in cs:citation set to ”; ”, collapse set to “year”, and cite-group-delimiter set to ”,”, citations look like “(Doe 1999,2001; Jones 2000)”.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.CitationElement.CiteGroupDelimiterSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'cite-group-delimiter' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.CitationElement.Collapse
member.summary: Activates cite grouping and collapsing.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.CitationElement.CollapseSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'collapse' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.CitationElement.YearSuffixDelimiter
member.summary: Specifies the delimiter for year-suffixes. Defaults to the delimiter set on cs:layout in cs:citation. E.g. with collapse set to “year-suffix”, delimiter on cs:layout in cs:citation set to ”; ”, and year-suffix-delimiter set to ”,”, citations look like “(Doe 1999a,b; Jones 2000)”.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.CitationElement.YearSuffixDelimiterSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'year-suffix-delimiter' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.CitationElement.AfterCollapseDelimiter
member.summary: Specifies the cite delimiter to be used after a collapsed cite group. Defaults to the delimiter set on cs:layout in cs:citation. E.g. with collapse set to “year”, delimiter on cs:layout in cs:citation set to ”, ”, and after-collapse-delimiter set to ”; ”, citations look like “(Doe 1999, 2001; Jones 2000, Brown 2001)”.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.CitationElement.AfterCollapseDelimiterSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'after-collapse-delimiter' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.CitationElement.NearNoteDistance
member.summary: A cite tests true for the “near-note” position (see Choose) when a preceding note exists that a) refers to the same item and b) does not precede the current note by more footnotes or endnotes than the value of near-note-distance (default value is “5”).

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.CitationElement.NearNoteDistanceSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'near-note-distance' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: T:CiteProc.v10.CitationClass
member.summary: Determines whether the style uses in-text citations (value “in-text”) or notes (“note”).

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.CitationClass.InText
member.summary: In-text citations.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.CitationClass.Note
member.summary: Note citations.

member.name: T:CiteProc.v10.CitationFormat
member.summary: Describes how in-text citations are rendered.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.CitationFormat.AuthorDate
member.summary: “author-date” - e.g. ”... (Doe, 1999)”

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.CitationFormat.Author
member.summary: “author” - e.g. ”... (Doe)”

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.CitationFormat.Numeric
member.summary: “numeric” - e.g. ”... [1]”

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.CitationFormat.Label
member.summary: “label” - e.g. ”... [doe99]”

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.CitationFormat.Note
member.summary: “note” - the citation appears as a footnote or endnote

member.name: T:CiteProc.Compilation.Compiler
member.summary: Represents the root of the snippet tree.

member.name: T:CiteProc.v10.DelimiterBehavior
member.summary: Specifies the behavior of delimiters for the delimiter-precedes-et-al and delimiter-precedes-last attributes on cs:name.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.DelimiterBehavior.Contextual
member.summary: “contextual” - (default), name delimiter is only used for name lists truncated to two or more (delimiter-precedes-et-al) or three or more (delimiter-precedes-last) names.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.DelimiterBehavior.AfterInvertedName
member.summary: “after-inverted-name” - name delimiter is only used if the preceding name is inverted as a result of the name-as-sort-order attribute.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.DelimiterBehavior.Always
member.summary: “always” - name delimiter is always used.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.DelimiterBehavior.Never
member.summary: “never” - name delimiter is never used.

member.name: T:CiteProc.v10.DemotingBehavior
member.summary: Describes the display and sorting behavior of the non-dropping-particle in inverted names (e.g. “de” in “Koning, W. de”).

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.DemotingBehavior.Never
member.summary: “never”: the non-dropping-particle is treated as part of the family name, whereas the dropping-particle is appended (e.g. “de Koning, W.”, “La Fontaine, Jean de”). The non-dropping-particle is part of the primary sort key (sort order A, e.g. “de Koning, W.” appears under “D”).

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.DemotingBehavior.SortOnly
member.summary: “sort-only”: same display behavior as “never”, but the non-dropping-particle is demoted to a secondary sort key (sort order B, e.g. “de Koning, W.” appears under “K”).

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.DemotingBehavior.DisplayAndSort
member.summary: “display-and-sort” (default): the dropping and non-dropping-particle are appended (e.g. “Koning, W. de” and “Fontaine, Jean de La”). For name sorting, all particles are part of the secondary sort key (sort order B, e.g. “Koning, W. de” appears under “K”).

member.name: T:CiteProc.v10.Display
member.summary: The display attribute (similar the “display” property in CSS) may be used to structure individual bibliographic entries into one or more text blocks. If used, all rendering elements should be under the control of a display attribute.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.Display.Block
member.summary: Block stretching from margin to margin.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.Display.LeftMargin
member.summary: Block starting at the left margin. If followed by a “right-inline” block, the “left-margin” blocks of all bibliographic entries are set to a fixed width to accommodate the longest content string found among these “left-margin” blocks. In the absence of a “right-inline” block the “left-margin” block extends to the right margin.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.Display.RightInline
member.summary: block starting to the right of a preceding “left-margin” block (behaves as “block” in the absence of such a “left-margin” block). Extends to the right margin.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.Display.Indent
member.summary: Block indented to the right by a standard amount. Extends to the right margin.

member.name: T:CiteProc.v10.IGlobalOptions
member.summary: Global options, which affect both citations and the bibliography, are set on the cs:style element.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.IGlobalOptions.InitializeWithHyphen
member.summary: Specifies whether compound given names (e.g. “Jean-Luc”) should be initialized with a hyphen (“J.-L.”, value “true”, default) or without (“J.L.”, value “false”).

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.IGlobalOptions.InitializeWithHyphenSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'initialize-with-hyphen' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.IGlobalOptions.PageRangeFormat
member.summary: Activates expansion or collapsing of page ranges. If the attribute is not set, page ranges are rendered without reformatting.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.IGlobalOptions.PageRangeFormatSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'page-range-format' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.IGlobalOptions.DemoteNonDroppingParticle
member.summary: Sets the display and sorting behavior of the non-dropping-particle in inverted names (e.g. “Koning, W. de”).

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.IGlobalOptions.DemoteNonDroppingParticleSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'demote-non-dropping-particle' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.IPersonalName.FamilyName
member.summary: Surname minus any particles and suffixes.

member.name: P:CiteProc.IPersonalName.GivenNames
member.summary: Given names, either full (“John Edward”) or initialized (“J. E.”)

member.name: P:CiteProc.IPersonalName.Suffix
member.summary: Name suffix, e.g. “Jr.” in “John Smith Jr.” and “III” in “Bill Gates III”.

member.name: P:CiteProc.IPersonalName.NonDroppingParticles
member.summary: Name particles that are not dropped when only the surname is shown (“de” in the Dutch surname “de Koning”) but which may be treated separately from the family name, e.g. for sorting.

member.name: P:CiteProc.IPersonalName.DroppingParticles
member.summary: Name particles that are dropped when only the surname is shown (“van” in “Ludwig van Beethoven”, which becomes “Beethoven”).

member.name: T:CiteProc.v10.IStripPeriods
member.summary: Represents an element with a strip-periods attribute.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.IStripPeriods.StripPeriods
member.summary: When set to “true” (“false” is the default), any periods in the rendered text are removed.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.IStripPeriods.StripPeriodsSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'strip-periods' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: T:CiteProc.v10.NameFormat
member.summary: Describes the rendering format of a name.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.NameFormat.Long
member.summary: “long”: all the name-parts of personal names will be rendered.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.NameFormat.Short
member.summary: “short”: only the family name and the non-dropping-particle will be rendered.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.NameFormat.Count
member.summary: “count”: returns the total number of names that would otherwise be rendered by the use of the cs:names element (taking into account the effects of et-al abbreviation and editor/translator collapsing). Allows for advanced sorting.

member.name: T:CiteProc.v10.NamePartName
member.summary: Specifies the part of a name.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.NamePartName.Family
member.summary: The family name part, including any non-dropping particles.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.NamePartName.Given
member.summary: The given name part, including any dropping particles.

member.name: T:CiteProc.v10.NameSortOptions
member.summary: Specifies the order of the name parts (e.g. “John Doe” vs. “Doe, John”).

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.NameSortOptions.None
member.summary: None of the names will be inverted.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.NameSortOptions.First
member.summary: “first”: only the first name in a list will be inverted.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.NameSortOptions.All
member.summary: “all”: a;; names in a list will be inverted.

member.name: T:CiteProc.v10.PageRangeFormats
member.summary: Represents the available page range abbreviation rules.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.PageRangeFormats.Chicago
member.summary: Page ranges are abbreviated according to the Chicago Manual of Style-rules.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.PageRangeFormats.Expanded
member.summary: Abbreviated page ranges are expanded to their non-abbreviated form: 42–45, 321–328, 2787–2816.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.PageRangeFormats.Minimal
member.summary: All digits repeated in the second number are left out: 42–5, 321–8, 2787–816.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.PageRangeFormats.MinimalTwo
member.summary: As “minimal”, but at least two digits are kept in the second number when it has two or more digits long.

member.name: T:CiteProc.v10.Position
member.summary: Specifies conditions on the position of a cite in a citation.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.Position.First
member.summary: “first”: position of cites that are the first to reference an item.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.Position.Ibid
member.summary: Cites referencing previously cited items, for which either a. the current cite immediately follows on another cite, within the same citation, that references the same item, or b. the current cite is the first cite in the citation, and the previous citation consists of a single cite referencing the same item and the item either has no locator or the locator is the same as the previously cited item.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.Position.IbidWithLocator
member.summary: Cites referencing previously cited items, for which either a. the current cite immediately follows on another cite, within the same citation, that references the same item, or b. the current cite is the first cite in the citation, and the previous citation consists of a single cite referencing the same item and the item has a different locator from the previously cited item.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.Position.Subsequent
member.summary: Cites referencing previously cited items have the “subsequent” position.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.Position.NearNote
member.summary: “near-note”: position of a cite following another cite referencing the same item. Both cites have to be located in foot or endnotes, and the distance between both cites may not exceed the maximum distance (measured in number of foot or endnotes) set with the near-note-distance option.

member.summary: For cs:text elements rendered with the quotes attribute set to “true” (see Formatting), and for which the output is followed by a comma or period, punctuation-in-quote specifies whether this punctuation is placed outside (value “false”, default) or inside (value “true”) the closing quotation mark.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.StyleOptionsElement.PunctuationInQuoteSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'punctuation-in-quote' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: T:CiteProc.v10.SubsequentAuthorSubstituteRules
member.summary: Specifies when and how names within bibliographies are substituted as a result of subsequent-author-substitute.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.SubsequentAuthorSubstituteRules.CompleteAll
member.summary: “complete-all” - (default), when all rendered names of the name variable match those in the preceding bibliographic entry, the value of subsequent-author-substitute replaces the entire name list (including punctuation and terms like “et al” and “and”), except for the affixes set on the cs:names element.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.SubsequentAuthorSubstituteRules.CompleteEach
member.summary: “complete-each” - requires a complete match like “complete-all”, but now the value of subsequent-author-substitute substitutes for each rendered name.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.SubsequentAuthorSubstituteRules.PartialEach
member.summary: “partial-each” - when one or more rendered names in the name variable match those in the preceding bibliographic entry, the value of subsequent-author-substitute substitutes for each matching name. Matching starts with the first name, and continues up to the first mismatch.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.SubsequentAuthorSubstituteRules.PartialFirst
member.summary: “partial-first” - as “partial-each”, but substitution is limited to the first name of the name variable.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.DateElement.DateParts
member.summary: For date formats with the form attribute specified, the attributes set on these elements override those specified for the localized date formats. In the absence of the form attribute, cs:date describes a self-contained non-localized date format. In this case, the date format is constructed using cs:date-part child elements. With a required name attribute set to either day, month or year, the order of these elements reflects the display order of respectively the day, month, and year.

member.summary: The display attribute (similar the “display” property in CSS) may be used to structure individual bibliographic entries into one or more text blocks. If used, all rendering elements should be under the control of a display attribute.

member.summary: Indicates whether the 'display' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: T:CiteProc.v10.GroupElement
member.summary: The cs:group rendering element must contain one or more rendering elements (with the exception of cs:layout). cs:group may carry the delimiter attribute to separate its child elements, as well as affixes and display attributes (applied to the output of the group as a whole) and formatting attributes (transmitted to the enclosed elements). cs:group implicitly acts as a conditional: cs:group and its child elements are suppressed if a) at least one rendering element in cs:group calls a variable (either directly or via a macro), and b) all variables that are called are empty.

member.name: T:CiteProc.v10.LocaleElement
member.summary: Represents localization data which can be included in a styles. Each locale element contains localization data for a single language dialect. This locale code is set on the required xml:lang attribute on the cs:locale root element.

member.summary: The locale code of this locale.

member.summary: Style options of the locale.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.LocaleElement.Dates
member.summary: Two localized date formats can be defined with cs:date elements: a “numeric” (e.g. “12-15-2005”) and a “text” format.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.LocaleElement.Terms
member.summary: Terms are localized strings (e.g. by using the “and” term, “Doe and Smith” automatically becomes “Doe und Smith” when the style locale is switched from English to German). Terms are either directly defined in the content of cs:term, or, in cases where singular and plural variants are needed (e.g. “page” and “pages”), in the content of the child elements cs:single and cs:multiple, respectively.

member.name: T:CiteProc.v10.MacroElement
member.summary: Macros allow formatting instructions to be reused, keeping styles compact and maintainable. The use of macros can improve style readability, compactness and maintainability. It is recommended to keep the contents of cs:citation and cs:bibliography compact and agnostic of item types (e.g. books, journal articles, etc.) by depending on macro calls. To allow for easy reuse of macros in other styles, it is recommended to use common macro names.

member.summary: Compiles this macro element.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.MacroElement.Children
member.summary: The child elements to be rendered.

member.name: T:CiteProc.v10.Match
member.summary: Control the testing logic of a cs:choose element.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.Match.All
member.summary: Default. Elements only tests “true” when all conditions test “true” for all given test values.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.Match.Any
member.summary: Element tests “true” when any condition tests “true” for any given test value.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.Match.None
member.summary: Element only tests “true” when none of the conditions test “true” for any given test value.

member.summary: The delimiter attribute delimits non-empty pieces of output.

member.name: T:CiteProc.v10.NamesElement
member.summary: The cs:names rendering element outputs the contents of one or more name variables (selected with the required variable attribute), each of which can contain multiple names (e.g. the “author” variable contains all the author names of the cited item). If multiple variables are selected (separated by single spaces, see example below), each variable is independently rendered in the order specified, with one exception: when the selection consists of “editor” and “translator”, and when the contents of these two name variables is identical, then the contents of only one name variable is rendered.

member.name: M:CiteProc.v10.NamesElement.Compile(CiteProc.Compilation.Scope)
member.summary: Compiles this Names element.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.NamesElement.Variable
member.summary: Selects the names variables to be used.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.NamesElement.Delimiter
member.summary: Separates the names of the different name variables (e.g. the semicolon in “Doe, Smith (editors); Johnson (translator)”).

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.NamesElement.Name
member.summary: The cs:name element can be used to describe the formatting of individual names, and the separation of names within a name variable.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.NamesElement.EtAl
member.summary: Et-al abbreviation can be further customized with the optional cs:et-al element.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.NamesElement.Substitute
member.summary: The optional cs:substitute element adds substitution in case the name variables specified in the parent cs:names element are empty. The substitutions are specified as child elements of cs:substitute, and must consist of one or more rendering elements (with the exception of cs:layout).

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.NamesElement.Display
member.summary: The display attribute (similar the “display” property in CSS) may be used to structure individual bibliographic entries into one or more text blocks. If used, all rendering elements should be under the control of a display attribute.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.NamesElement.DisplaySpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'display' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: T:CiteProc.v10.NumberElement
member.summary: The cs:number rendering element outputs the number variable selected with the required variable attribute. A number variable is rendered with cs:number and only contains numeric content (as determined by the rules for is-numeric), the number(s) are extracted. Variable content is rendered “as is” when the variable contains any non-numeric content (e.g. “Special edition”).

member.summary: Determines when the name delimiter or a space is used between a truncated name list and the “et-al” (or “and others”) term in case of et-al abbreviation.

member.summary: If the number of names in a name variable matches or exceeds the number set on et-al-min, the rendered name list is truncated.

member.summary: Indicates whether the 'et-al-min' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.summary: If the number of names in a name variable is truncated, it is truncated after reaching the number of names set on et-al-use-first.

member.summary: Indicates whether the 'et-al-first' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.summary: If the number of names in a name variable is truncated, it is truncated after reaching the number of names set on et-al-use-first.

member.summary: Indicates whether the 'et-al-subsequent-min' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.StyleFile.EtAlSubsequentUseFirst
member.summary: If the number of names in a name variable is truncated, it is truncated after reaching the number of names set on et-al-use-first.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.StyleFile.EtAlSubsequentUseFirstSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'et-al-subsequent-use-first' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.StyleFile.EtAlUseLast
member.summary: When set to “true” (the default is “false”), name lists truncated by et-al abbreviation are followed by the name delimiter, the ellipsis character, and the last name of the original name list. This is only possible when the original name list has at least two more names than the truncated name list.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.StyleFile.EtAlUseLastSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'et-al-use-last' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.StyleFile.NameFormat
member.summary: Specifies whether all the name-parts of personal names should be displayed (value “long”, the default), or only the family name and the non-dropping-particle (value “short”). A third value, “count”, returns the total number of names that would otherwise be rendered by the use of the cs:names element (taking into account the effects of et-al abbreviation and editor/translator collapsing), which allows for advanced sorting.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.StyleFile.NameFormatSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'name-form' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.StyleFile.CiteProc#v10#INameOptions#Format
member.summary: Specifies whether all the name-parts of personal names should be displayed (value “long”, the default), or only the family name and the non-dropping-particle (value “short”). A third value, “count”, returns the total number of names that would otherwise be rendered by the use of the cs:names element (taking into account the effects of et-al abbreviation and editor/translator collapsing), which allows for advanced sorting.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.StyleFile.CiteProc#v10#INameOptions#FormatSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'name-form' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.StyleFile.Initialize
member.summary: When set to “false” (the default is “true”), given names are no longer initialized when “initialize-with” is set. However, the value of “initialize-with” is still added after initials present in the full name (e.g. with initialize set to “false”, and initialize-with set to ”.”, “James T Kirk” becomes “James T. Kirk”).

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.StyleFile.InitializeSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'initialize' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.StyleFile.InitializeWith
member.summary: When set, given names are converted to initials. The attribute value is added after each initial (”.” results in “J.J. Doe”).

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.StyleFile.NameAsSortOrder
member.summary: Specifies that names should be displayed with the given name following the family name (e.g. “John Doe” becomes “Doe, John”).

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.StyleFile.NameAsSortOrderSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'name-as-sort-order' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.StyleFile.SortSeparator
member.summary: Sets the delimiter for name-parts that have switched positions as a result of name-as-sort-order. The default value is ”, ” (“Doe, John”). As is the case for name-as-sort-order, this attribute only affects names written in the latin or Cyrillic alphabets.

member.name: T:CiteProc.v10.StyleInfoElement
member.summary: The cs:info element contains the style’s metadata. Its structure is based on the Atom Syndication Format.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.StyleInfoElement.Id
member.summary: The element should contain a URI to establish the identity of the style. A stable, unique and dereferenceable URI is desired for publicly available styles.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.StyleInfoElement.Title
member.summary: The contents of cs:title should be the name of the style as shown to users.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.StyleInfoElement.TitleShort
member.summary: The contents of cs:title-short should be a shortened style name (e.g. “APA”).

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.StyleInfoElement.Summary
member.summary: The contents of cs:summary gives a (short) description of the style.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.StyleInfoElement.Authors
member.summary: Acknowledges the author(s) of the style.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.StyleInfoElement.Contributors
member.summary: Acknowledges contributor(s) to the style.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.StyleInfoElement.Categories
member.summary: Styles may be assigned one or more categories. A single categorie may be used to describe how in-text citations are rendered using the citation-format attribute. Multiple categories may be used with the field attribute, set to one of the discipline categories, to indicate the field(s) for which the style is relevant.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.StyleInfoElement.Links
member.summary: May be used multiple times. cs:link must carry two attributes: href, set to a URI (usually a URL), and rel, whose value indicates how the URI relates to the style.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.StyleInfoElement.Rights
member.summary: The contents of cs:rights specifies the license under which the style file is released. The element may carry a license attribute to specify the URI of the license.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.StyleInfoElement.ISSN
member.summary: The cs:issn element may be used multiple times to indicate the ISSN identifier(s) of the journal for which the style was written.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.StyleInfoElement.eISSN
member.summary: The cs:eissn element may be used once for the eISSN identifier.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.StyleInfoElement.ISSNL
member.summary: The cs:issnl elements may be used once for the ISSN-L identifier.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.StyleInfoElement.Published
member.summary: The contents of cs:published must be a timestamp, indicating when the style was initially created or made available.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.StyleInfoElement.PublishedSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'published' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.StyleInfoElement.Updated
member.summary: The contents of cs:updated must be a timestamp that shows when the style was last updated.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.StyleInfoElement.UpdatedSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'updates' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: T:CiteProc.v10.SubstituteElement
member.summary: The optional cs:substitute element adds substitution in case the name variables specified in the parent cs:names element are empty. The substitutions are specified as child elements of cs:substitute, and must consist of one or more rendering elements (with the exception of cs:layout).

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.SubstituteElement.Children
member.summary: Gets or sets the rendering elements to substite, if the variable in the parent names element is empty.

member.summary: A term is used when the last digit in the term name matches the last digit of the rendered number.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.TermMatch.LastTwoDigits
member.summary: By setting the optional match attribute to “last-two-digits” (“last-digit” is the default), matches are limited to numbers where the two last digits agree (“0”, “100”, “200”, etc.)

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.TermMatch.WholeNumber
member.summary: When match is set to “whole-number”, there is only a match if the number is the same as that of the term.

member.name: T:CiteProc.v10.TextElement
member.summary: The cs:text rendering element outputs text. It must carry one of the following attributes to select what should be rendered: variable, macro, value or term.

member.name: M:CiteProc.v10.TextElement.Compile(CiteProc.Compilation.Scope)
member.summary: Compiles this Text element.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.TextElement.Variable
member.summary: Renders the text contents of a variable.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.TextElement.Macro
member.summary: Renders the text output of a macro. Attribute value must match the value of the name attribute of a cs:macro element.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.TextElement.Value
member.summary: Renders the literal text in the value attribute.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.TextElement.Term
member.summary: Renders a term. May be accompanied by the plural attribute to select the singular or plural variant of a term, and by the form attribute to select the “long” (default), “short”, “verb”, “verb-short” or “symbol” form variant.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.TextElement.TermSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'term' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.TextElement.Plural
member.summary: The plural attribute selects the singular (“false”, default) or plural (“true”) variant of a term.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.TextElement.PluralSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'plural' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.TextElement.Format
member.summary: The form attribute Select the “long” (default), “short”, “verb”, “verb-short” or “symbol” form variant of a term.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.TextElement.FormatSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'form' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.TextElement.Quotes
member.summary: When set to “true” (“false” is default), the rendered text is wrapped in quotes (the quotation marks used are terms). The localized punctuation-in-quote option controls whether an adjoining comma or period appears outside (default) or inside the closing quotation mark.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.TextElement.QuotesSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'quotes' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.TextElement.StripPeriods
member.summary: When set to “true” (“false” is the default), any periods in the rendered text are removed.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.TextElement.StripPeriodsSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'strip-periods' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.TextElement.TextCase
member.summary: When specified, converts the rendered text to the given case.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.TextElement.TextCaseSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'text-case' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.TextElement.Display
member.summary: The display attribute (similar the “display” property in CSS) may be used to structure individual bibliographic entries into one or more text blocks. If used, all rendering elements should be under the control of a display attribute.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.TextElement.DisplaySpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'display' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: T:CiteProc.v10.TextCase
member.summary: Represents the available text cases.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.TextCase.Lowercase
member.summary: Renders text in lowercase.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.TextCase.Uppercase
member.summary: Renders text in uppercase.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.TextCase.CapitalizeFirst
member.summary: Capitalizes the first character of the first word, if the word is lowercase.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.TextCase.CapitalizeAll
member.summary: Capitalizes the first character of every lowercase word.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.TextCase.Sentence
member.summary: Renders text in sentence case.

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.TextCase.Title
member.summary: Renders text in title case.

member.name: T:CiteProc.v10.TextDecoration
member.summary: Specifies the text decoration (none or underline).

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.TextDecoration.None
member.summary: “none” (default).

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.TextDecoration.Underline
member.summary: “underline”.

member.name: T:CiteProc.v10.TermElement
member.summary: A term represents a localized text string.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.TermElement.Name
member.summary: The name of the term.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.TermElement.Format
member.summary: Terms may be defined for specific forms by using cs:term with the optional form attribute.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.TermElement.FormatSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'form' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.TermElement.Match
member.summary: Specifies the way terms are matched to ordinals.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.TermElement.MatchSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'match' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.TermElement.Gender
member.summary: Specifies the requested gender of a ordinal rendered for this term.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.TermElement.GenderSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'gender' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.TermElement.GenderForm
member.summary: Specifies the gender of the ordinal term (e.g. 1re is feminine, while 1er is masculin).

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.TermElement.GenderFormSpecified
member.summary: Indicates whether the 'gender-form' attribute is specified. Required by System.Xml.XmlSerializer.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.TermElement.Value
member.summary: The translation for the term.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.TermElement.Single
member.summary: The translated term for a single item.

member.name: P:CiteProc.v10.TermElement.Multiple
member.summary: The translated term for multiple items.

member.name: T:CiteProc.v10.VerticalAlign
member.summary: Specifies the vertical alignment (baseline, subscript or superscript).

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.VerticalAlign.Baseline
member.summary: “baseline” (default).

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.VerticalAlign.Superscript
member.summary: “sup” (superscript).

member.name: F:CiteProc.v10.VerticalAlign.Subscript
member.summary: “sup” (subscript).
